name: Mummified Undead
background:
The Mummified Undead command a massive army of undying skeletons and mummies. They are supported by great constructs made of bone and rock, animated by their Gods.

These undead creatures are the shambling corpses left behind when their once prosperous Kingdoms collapsed. When the Desert Gods were driven from the underworld by the Gods of Havoc, their followers were barred from the afterlife. Since then, their souls have been shackled to their lifeless bodies. Only their new Queen offers them the hope of final death.
backgroundFull:
The Mummified Undead were once a Human kingdom in the southern desert lands of Tyria. These people worshipped the Desert Gods, powerful beings which existed at the source of the great river which flowed between the world of the living and the dead. Protected from invasion by great swathes of desert, the Kingdom prospered for generations in the south. 

The Kingdom’s fortunes changed with the arrival of the Havoc Gods. The Havoc Gods sought out the Desert Gods and their Underworld, hoping to seal off death itself from Tyria. The Desert Gods tried to fight back, but were defeated. The Gatekeeper, who guarded the passage between the world of the living and dead, was slain, and the god’s blood poisoned the river passage between worlds. Since that moment, any soul that tried to pass on would be trapped in the poisoned river between worlds, existing in a state of constant agony. 

The remaining Desert Gods gave their priests Soul Gems, which could bind souls to their bodies. The Gems’ magic preserved the bones, allowing souls to linger even after their bodies had withered away to old age or injury. The Priests developed a form of mummification to allow people to preserve some part of their bodies. Those who could afford such treatments sought them out, while others slowly saw their flesh fall away until all that remained was bone. 

The Kingdom collapsed in the wake of the curse, as once vital farmlands lay barren and people fell into despair. The Mummified Undead were ruled over by a variety of lesser kings and petty tyrants who began to carve out kingdoms throughout the land. This led to a long era of civil war, as no one held the means to claim a final victory and reunite these lands into a single Kingdom. 

This changed with the arrival of a powerful sorceress from the north, claiming to be the heir of a mighty Empire. She approached the priests and kings of the land and promised that she alone had the power to discover a means to break their curse and bring them true death. Impressed with her power, her allies declared her the Tomb Queen, and soon reunified the realm under her rule, reigning over a variety of petty kingdoms and cultures which have emerged along the sacred river. 

Now, the Tomb Queen looks north to her former home. How will you embrace true death?

spells.name: Desert Storm
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which counts as being in Difficult Terrain once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Storm of Skulls
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 18", which takes 1 hit with Blast(3).

spells.name: Cursed Arrows
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Shred when shooting once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)
once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Rapid Desiccation
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy models within 24", which take 1 hit with AP(4) each.

spells.name: Tomb Queen's Guidance
spells.effect: Pick up to six friendly units within 12", which get Royal Legion Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Tomb Queen's Vengeance
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 12", which take 2 hits with AP(1) and Perforate each. Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

parameters.name: spellHitRoll
parameters.value: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

spellHitRoll.name: Roll as many dice as hits to see if "on rolls of 6" effects trigger.

specialRules.name: Piercing Spotter
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of this model and roll one die, on a 4+ place a marker on it. When attacking, friendly units may remove markers from their target before rolling to block to get +AP(X), where X is the number of removed markers.

specialRules.name: Sergeant
specialRules.description: When this model attacks, unmodified results of 6 to hit deal 1 extra hit (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Royal Legion
specialRules.description: This model gets +3" range when shooting and moves +3" when using Charge actions.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Fighter
specialRules.description: When in melee, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Armor
specialRules.description: Counts as having Defense X+.

specialRules.name: No Retreat Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get No Retreat. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Perforate
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and on unmodified results of 6 to hit that aren't blocked, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Mend
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one friendly model within 3" with Tough, and remove D3 wounds from it.

specialRules.name: Royal Legion Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Royal Legion Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Scout Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Scout. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Fortified Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Fortified. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Resistance Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Resistance. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Bane in Melee Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Bane in melee. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Difficult Terrain Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which counts as being in Difficult Terrain once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Indirect when Shooting Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Indirect when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: No Retreat
specialRules.description: Whenever a unit where most models have this rule fails a morale test that causes it to be Shaken or Routed, the test counts as passed instead. Then, roll as many dice as the number of wounds it would take to check for wound effects (must always roll at least 1 die), and for each result of 1-3 the unit takes one wound, which can't be ignored.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model only rolls to check wound effects once it has taken at least X wounds, and is only Knocked Out on rolls of 5+X or more.

specialRules.name: Royal Legion Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Royal Legion, it gets +6" range when shooting and moves +6" when using Charge actions from Royal Legion (instead of only +3" and +3").

specialRules.name: Scout
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. After all other units are deployed, may be deployed anywhere fully within 12” of their deployment zone. Players alternate in placing Scout units, starting with the player that activates next.

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Resistance
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 6+ it is ignored. If the wounds were from a spell, then they are ignored on a 2+ instead.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.

specialRules.name: Indirect
specialRules.description: Gets -1 to hit rolls when shooting after moving. May target enemies that are not in line of sight as if in line of sight, and ignores cover from sight obstructions.

specialRules.name: Blast
specialRules.description: Ignores cover, and after resolving other special rules, each hit is multiplied by X, where X is up to as many hits as enemy models in the target unit and within 3” of it. Hits must be split evenly between all enemy units within 3” of any model from the target (defender picks how).

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.
